text: Sir Matthew Walker Montgomery LLD DL (18 April 1859Scotland, Select Births and Baptisms, 1564-1950 - 8 August 1933) was a Scottish businessman who served as Lord Provost of Glasgow from 1923 to 1926. ==Life== Restored grave of Sir M W Montgomery, Glasgow Necropolis He was born in Hutchesontown, Glasgow, the son of Daniel Montgomery and Mary Sommerville Walker. The family lived at 41 Adelphi Street in Glasgow, on the south bank of the River Clyde. The family business, making cork, was originally based at 1 Muirhead Street in the Gorbals district.Glasgow Post Office Directory 1859 He worked in his father's firm of D. Montgomery & Son, cork manufacturers and merchants, based at 10 East Clyde Street at the turn of the century, on the north side of the River Clyde opposite the family home.Glasgow Post Office Directory 1900 From 1911 to 1913, he was Grand Master of the Glasgow Star Masonic Lodge (no.219).http://glasgowstar219.co.uk/history.html He then lived at 34 Dalziel Drive in the Pollokshields district.Glasgow Post Office Directory 1911 He was painted in office by Charles Haslewood Shannon.https://artuk.org/discover/artworks/sir-matthew-w- montgomery-18591933-lord-provost-of-glasgow-19231926-86047 After serving as Lord Provost of Glasgow from 1923 to 1926, he was knighted in the 1926 New Year Honours. He was succeeded as Lord Provost by Sir David Mason. He died in Glasgow and is buried in the Glasgow Necropolis.Scotland, National Probate Index (Calendar of Confirmations and Inventories), 1876-1936 The grave lies to the south-east of the upper plateau. It was restored in 2019. ==Family== He was married to Helen Mason (1871-1926). ==References== Category:1859 births Category:1933 deaths Category:People from Gorbals Category:Scottish businesspeople Category:Lord Provosts of Glasgow Category:Knights Bachelor Category:Scottish Freemasons Category:Burials at the Glasgow Necropolis
